titleStmt.title: The Quakers unmasked, and clearly detected to be but the spawn of Romish frogs, Jesuites, and Franciscan fryers; sent from Rome to seduce the intoxicated giddy-headed English nation. By an information newly taken upon oath in the city of Bristol, Jan. 22. 1654. and some evident demonstrations. / By William Prynne of Swainswick, Esq;.
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

titleStmt.title: The Quakers unmasked, and clearly detected to be but the spawn of Romish frogs, Jesuites, and Franciscan fryers; sent from Rome to seduce the intoxicated giddy-headed English nation. By an information newly taken upon oath in the city of Bristol, Jan. 22. 1654. and some evident demonstrations. / By William Prynne of Swainswick, Esq;.
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edward Thomas in Green Arbour,

notesStmt.note: In part a reply to: Audland, John. The innocent delivered out of the snare, and the blind guide fallen into the pit.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
